website_summaries.verdict: An ultra-light collapsible bottle lauded for its easy-sip lid, flexible build, and affordable price tag.
pros: Option to purchase .7 liter or 1 liter bottle
Flexible enough to keep in pocket
Includes remarkable easy-sip cap, though cap can be unscrewed for wide-mouth drinking
cons: Has trouble standing upright when filled with water

customer_reviews.title: Leaks!
customer_reviews.text: I first bought 2 Vapurs in 2015 and those bags traveled the world with us. Recently purchased 2 more for a trip to Europe. At the very first use.....I was soaked! See video. The other one was fine. Still disappointing :(
customer_reviews.author: Susan B,

customer_reviews.title: All around the world!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this from LA to Dubai and almost every airport in the western world! It's paid for itself many, many times! Today, though, I froze it (which I do often) and it fell, snapping half of the lid off! Of all places, it happened at home and not on the road?!? Time to a new order a new one!
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Castaneda

customer_reviews.title: Long-Time Customer Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This 2-pack order was my literal TENTH order of Vapur anti-bottles (I love them that much). I’ve been using Vapur for years and have always been happy with my purchases...until now. One of the two bottles I have was sealed inadequately and leaked in my purse. The cap was completely screwed tight and the lid was secured. The leak was coming from the seams :( The second bottle in the order has a cap that’s *too* tight and is difficult to open and close. Terrible quality control for this batch... maybe it’s time for me to start looking into another brand.
customer_reviews.author: garie

customer_reviews.title: Repeat customer
customer_reviews.text: I have had my first Vapur 3 years ago and have brought it along with me whenever I traveled, it has gone with me through multiple countries, airports, hikes and beaches and held up well. Extremely easy to use, I do not put it into the dish washer but do use a brush to rinse it out and leave it out to dry. Unfortunately after 3 years, there was a small leak at the bottom seal and we had to get a new one. I absolutely love the Vapur Eclipse, it is easy to use, study and pretty well built.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Best Travel Water Bottle...For One Reason
customer_reviews.text: The carabiner holds the whole thing together when you roll it up tightly. It takes up so little room this way. The cap snaps together very tight, which is good because I toss this in with my gear in the main compartment of my bag and it has yet to spill or leak. The only problem with these types of water bottles is condensation on the outside if you fill it up with cold water. Otherwise, it's my favorite travel bottle. They last for a while too. I would still be using my first one if I didn't lose it. After a while, it will look beat up, but it will work just as good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Kien

customer_reviews.title: Best for traveling and daily hydration!
customer_reviews.text: Love these. I say these because its the 5th or 6th ive purchased in the past year. Not because of durability, these things take a beating! Trust me on that, I've taken them around the world a handful of times. But, also lose them regularly because of that as well! The convenience is immeasurable. The value of not having to buy water bottles- savings galore!! Can't say enough. Even if you don't travel- it's a great way to stay on top of your daily hydration!!
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Leaked at fold after 2 uses.  Replacement lasted 6 uses.
customer_reviews.text: My first review: Great Size. Great Design. No bad water taste. Sprung leak on bottom at fold after second use. Company replaced it. Rinse and repeat, left my butt soaked on a 5 mile in the winter desert. Don’t buy this size.
customer_reviews.author: Epador

customer_reviews.title: Great for backpacking and traveling in general
customer_reviews.text: I've had this bottle a few weeks now and am rather pleased with it. My wife and I took ours on our last trip to Europe and I had zero complaints with this bottle. It's easy to fill in airports without the water bottle filling stations, collapses easily for going through security and is a great bottle for carrying around daily. We backpacked through Europe and were limited on space -- this was ideal!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great commuter water bottle
customer_reviews.text: I've been a fan of Vapur bottles for years, and I've left more than a few around the world on accident. I just like that I can fold them up and put them in a small pocket and be good to go. They do tend to wear out easier than Nalgene bottles (obviously), but it's a fair tradeoff for convenience. If you travel or commute, then they're something you should be carrying. I carry one in my backpack and it makes bottle fills after airport security much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Good quality travel water bottle
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Vapur foldable water bottles for years. They last approximately 3-4 years of constant use before they breakdown. They are not the easiest to clean on the inside and do not dry very fast either, but that doesn't bother me. I like these because they are high quality, lightweight, and take up very little room/space when not in use. They are reusable which saves me from having to buy bottled water when I travel. Vapur is the only brand I buy and I'm very pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: apchelden

customer_reviews.title: Love this! Great way to carry extra water
customer_reviews.text: I put this in a Molle-style bottle pouch and strap it to my bike's rear rack for hot days. I fill it about 90% at night, then put it in the freezer and have cold water for hours on my ride. I've frozen it dozens of times and no leakage. Stands up reasonably well. The wide cap opening takes small ice cubes reasonably well. I've never used it for hot beverages. I only wash by hand. Takes up almost no room when folded and it can be partially collapsed when partially full.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Johncox

customer_reviews.title: life saver
customer_reviews.text: I first want to point out that this water bottle is AMAZING for anyone using a back pack with a crappy water bottle holder due to its flat nature while empty. While full it is still awesome because its still more of an oval shape instead of a solid round shape. If its too tight just use the built in clip to clip it on your bag. Awesome water bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: The best collapsible water bottle yet
customer_reviews.text: I've had cheap collapsable water bottles before and it's easy to see this is a better product. I use this for skiing so it needs to be able to freeze, which it has done so already, and it holds up whereas the cheap ones puncture. No cheap plasticy taste either. Minor downside is that it does not dry easily. I keep it upside down and shake it from time to time to try and get the droplets out. I live in a dry climate too. Rinse it well and it should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Holden

customer_reviews.title: My kid's favorite.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these, in fact when I asked him about a new water bottle for this school year, he specifically asked for a Vapur. He said the clanging of everyone's Hydroflasks drives him bananas & he just wishes everyone carried one of these. Lol. He clips it to his backpack & carries it all day during classes, & as a young teen boy, he's not entirely careful with a lot of his possessions. So I would certainly say these hold up to a lot of abuse. I also love how they're dishwasher safe!
customer_reviews.author: latejune

customer_reviews.title: Very Versatile
customer_reviews.text: These are slightly too large (34 oz) for a tactical water pouch made for a 32 oz. bottle. I can still use them, just not completely full or they will stick out the top. I like that they can be frozen, so on a hike I will have cold water. They have a carabiner on top so you can just hang them on a backpack. I also like that when empty they fold up and can be stashed away until I’m ready to refill them.
customer_reviews.author: consumer999

customer_reviews.title: Trash. Save some time & just set your money on fire.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon sold this to me without the little closure that's supposed to be on the lid. Without that closure, water cannot stay inside the bag. So, it's absolutely useless. I discovered this *after* the 30 day return date. Before realizing I was sent defective merchandise that I would have been able to return for a working product had I bought it from *any other store*, I did try to use it. Water, which tasted *strongly* of plastic spilled all over my face. Assuming you get lucky and buy a usable version of this bottle, with all of its parts included, you'd better be someone who has an incredibly large mouth and/or *loves* the sharp tang of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Grammar Lady

customer_reviews.title: I named mine Reginald and he's served me well.
customer_reviews.text: This bottle is pretty great. I often bike to my clients, and the bottle gets slimmer as I hydrate, and fits in my laptop bag. When it's empty or when you want to store it, you can collapse it and store it so it's harder to lose. Six months later the outer surface is a little discolored, but I'm not too concerned about it. On a recent vacation, my niece preferred to drink from "Reginald" rather than her water bottle. Reggie has served me well!
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: Great - small and wraps up really compact.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one i have bought as really liked first one. It is compact when rolled up and all pretty good quality - this is considering they have obviously tried to balance weight with overall durability. Definitely recommend for travel in airports etc. They don't fit well in normal sized car cupholders and the trick to drinking out is to turn and drink in line with the seam and not side on (as it crumples if you do that and need to do 2 handed).
customer_reviews.author: Aron

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Travel
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had discovered this sooner. I travel a lot and normally brought a Nalgene, which was light but very bulky. This is way lighter and takes up almost zero space. Seems like good quality, hopefully it holds up throughout my upcoming trip. I will update this if I run into any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Leaks, seal around cap is badly crafted.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy, product leaks. Bought this for a trip to Europe and we arrived today. Try to use at airport and both bottles leaked. The seals are not done correctly. The screw on cap works as intended, but the seal around has gaps. Very disappointed because we wanted to avoid purchasing disposable water bottles and now we need to buy those or spend money on reusable bottles which are pricey. This is the first time we used the product and we will return both bottles (bought 2, both leak) when we get back to US
customer_reviews.author: Claudia E

customer_reviews.title: LEAKY!
customer_reviews.text: I love the design of this and was so psyched to put it to use. But as soon as I dropped it—just from my lap to the floor while I was sitting—the seal from the bag to the lid broke and that was it. Every time I took a drink, water would leak out and dribble on my chin. And forget about putting it in a bag or anywhere it might tip. Too bad! Maybe they can improve the durability with time, but I can’t recommend it for this reason.
customer_reviews.author: trekkergal

customer_reviews.title: Request for Replacement!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased and satisfactorily used three Vapurs, but was surprised to discover that the exterior of this unit was often wet. At first, I mistakenly identified this condition as condensation or perhaps drippage from overfill. But it was not until I examined and tested the unit more closely that I discovered a tiny gap in the seal surrounding the head. This slow but steady leakage defect eventually caused water damage to the car seat as well as flooded my tote bag and its contents! I would appreciate a replacement and would be happy to return the defective for your inspection. Thanks & please advise.
customer_reviews.author: Lady M

customer_reviews.title: Compact, functional and need another one or three!!
customer_reviews.text: This big guy folds away into any pocket or space! Just remember to bring it or have it in your gear!! Great water carrier for any season. I mostly use it for urban carry but will take it when I go out camping, biking and roaming!! I approve this product!!!!
customer_reviews.author: OC

customer_reviews.title: A little awkward
customer_reviews.text: I like that this bottle holds a liter of water--that's terrific. However, as it empties, the top portion keeps flapping down, and it's hard to grab without spilling water all over me if I squeeze too hard. Also, because of the small spout, it's hard to clean other than rinsing it out, and the cap is impossible to open with one hand. But my biggest complaint is that it doesn't fit the cup holder in my car.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Sibley

customer_reviews.text: This bottle has become my favorite travel accessory especially with all the TSA rules regarding limits on liquid. I pack the bottle on every trip and once past security fill it in either a restaurant or airport lounge so you stay hydrated for your trip. It also can be filled once on the plane by asking the flight attendant which is nice since you don't have to wait for them to come around for more water. It comes with a nice clip which allows it to be easily clipped to the side of a bag.
customer_reviews.author: Dino

customer_reviews.title: One works great, the other leaked immediately
customer_reviews.text: Been using one around the house, at work and on a 3 week backpack trip with absolutely no issues. Went to use the 2nd one from the 2 pack for the first time on another trip and it leaked immediately into my pack with blue mio in it.. the seam on the threads is not fully sealed. Would love a replacement but not sure how to go about it.
customer_reviews.author: cam

customer_reviews.title: mixed feelings
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, but not great either. It holds water, yeah. But the material seems like it won't last. Its feels like a stiff plastic sheet. I would be careful putting it near anything with an edge, even keys. Overall its worked fine for me, but I dont know how much longer it will last. I'm not too convinced on the materials used.
customer_reviews.author: GabrielSanchezpr

customer_reviews.title: My favorite water bottle for travel
customer_reviews.text: I bring this everywhere with me when I travel! It holds a ton of water, easy to fill up, stands up on its own, collapses when it's empty and doesn't take up space. I also love that the carabiner allows me to attach to anything. This is my third order only because I keep leaving it places. Because it's so cost effective, I don't feel bad replacing either. Can't recommend this enough!
customer_reviews.author: Helen Wen

customer_reviews.title: Super useful for travel
customer_reviews.text: These Vapur bottles are perfect for travel. When empty, they roll up and fit in a pocket. My family used two of them while at Disney World and they were extremely handy. We could clip them to our stroller, and easily refill them in the park when empty. They are also perfect at the airport because you can carry them through security empty and fill them up on the other side. The flip cap unscrews for easy cleaning with a bottle brush, and they weigh next to nothing. All in all a very well designed, well executed product. You won’t be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Michael D Ricketts

customer_reviews.title: The best water bottle for traveling
customer_reviews.text: I am constantly drinking water, and when I was traveling, this handy dandy water bottle was a lifesaver. I wanted to pack light for a two-week trip in Europe, and having this didn't add any extra weight to my luggage. Plus, when it was empty, I could roll it up so it barely took up any space! Highly recommended for anyone who travels regularly or appreciates a water bottle that takes up zero space.
customer_reviews.author: Shireen

customer_reviews.title: Love it but...
customer_reviews.text: I have used this as my main water bottle for the last 2 years and love it! Up until recently the only time it leaked was when I didn’t screw the cap on all of the way. Totally my fault. But recently it started leaking just a little. So it’s time to order a new one. Now I’m looking at some new pretty colors.
customer_reviews.author: Jessa

customer_reviews.title: Yet I keep coming back because it is the best soft plastic and fold-able water bottle
customer_reviews.text: Eclipse model by Vapur keeps leaking after nearly a year of use. The leak comes from the seams between the soft plastic bladder and the hard plastic corkscrew where you thread the cap. Also the darker colors make it difficult to see your water level which is a pain especially when filling up. The matte coating also rubs away within month of usage. Yet I keep coming back because it is the best soft plastic and fold-able water bottle. Good for price. Dont listen to Wirecutter and their ''best collapsible water bottle'' recommendation,
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Good bottle for travel
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a trip. Easy to fill, rolls up tightly. NO problem with leaking as long as you make sure you close the cap. I was so confident, I actually tossed it in my purse with everything, regardless if it was upright. No issue. I do recommend using two hands to drink when very full, as the pouch can fold and shoot water at you. After it's a little empty, no problems. Inflate the bag with air to get the last of the water out, otherwise the vacuum keeps it in.
customer_reviews.author: Ali O.

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT hold .7 liter, holds .5
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept, not having that hard water bottle banging against me or my pack. However, this does NOT hold .7 liter. I measured it out, and it holds exactly .5. So two points off for misleading your customers. Also, I have my doubts as to how long it will last. The connection between water bottle membrane and threaded cap looks dicey. 1 point off for perceived lack of quality, imo.
customer_reviews.author: Jonas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bottle, carabineer could be slightly larger.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the compact, foldable aspect of this water bottle. The cap does not leak and clicks into place. The carabineer can fold down and can hold the bottle in it's rolled up state. I did take away 1 star because the carabineer might be a tad bit too small. You have to roll it up tight but the bottom is large. So, you have to fiddle it to fit. I still like it and used it daily.
customer_reviews.author: wilfred francis

customer_reviews.title: Great travel water bottle
customer_reviews.text: This water bottle is great for traveling, it folds up really small for airplanes but then can be filled with water. It's durable and can be easily clipped to a backpack. I like that you can use it as a "straw" water bottle by sucking from the nozzle without tipping the bottle up into the air, or you can tip the bottle into the air, whatever you prefer. It is a bit hard to clean since the opening is small, but I guess with a good brush it wouldn't be so bad. It's also comfortable to keep in a small fabric backpack because it's soft, it won't dig into your back like hard water bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Nacho

customer_reviews.title: Favorite bottle for years
customer_reviews.text: This is my third one of these in about 4 years. They are very durable and keep their shape and stand even if they only have a little water in them. I love being able to fold it up and toss it in my bag when it’s empty. I constantly get asked where I got it because it’s really cool looking. I’ve seen other brands that can be popped and leak easily but I never have had that issue with this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy Shea

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for long run hydration
customer_reviews.text: I love this bottle, i use it while running and I like it because of the light weight and easy open top. The only thing I don't really like is the color - it is more difficult to see any mold that might be forming due to this color, I have a red one that I can much more easily see any hint of mold and can address it right away. Other than that it is the perfect running bottle. The loop fits easily around my finger and makes it hard for me to drop, but easy to hold. Fits right in the crook of my arm while running.
customer_reviews.author: bclmb

customer_reviews.title: Never knew drinking water anywhere is easy
customer_reviews.text: The ability to carry water and a foldable flexible water pouch anywhere is exciting. I Love it Getting another one
customer_reviews.author: Chendellaw

customer_reviews.title: Great option for hiking
customer_reviews.text: Took this guy out on my last hike in the Sangres and it performed well. Love being able to deflate, roll up and store away without taking up much pack space or weight. The cap seals tight and did not leak. I will say that the plastic material absorbed a heavy campfire smell which I'm sure just about any collapsible bottle like this would. Tip: go with the 1L size. I purchased the .7L and went through the water inside in no time.
customer_reviews.author: tyler.ksu

customer_reviews.title: Nice backpacking bottle, but leaks after a while
customer_reviews.text: Great design. But has the same flaw of many of these type of flasks: after 20+/- the seal between the flexible plastic flask and the hard plastic nozzle/opening/screw mouth starts to leak. But unlike MSR platypus, the warranty for Vapur is only 1 year, not lifetime. But much better than Sawyer, which basically has not warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Steve P. Price

customer_reviews.title: Leaking After 3rd use
customer_reviews.text: Mine was leaking between the lid and the screw in the bottle (the bag itself is surprisingly durable) before the 3rd time using it. I use it mainaly for my snowboard trip, it can store into my jacket pocket easily. But the leaking problem, not sure why it will happend and how to fix it...
customer_reviews.author: ryan lin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome water bottle. I love it. I take it to school with me and I love that I can just fold it up when it’s empty. Literally fits in my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Corley

customer_reviews.title: Maybe not so great
customer_reviews.text: Use it for marathon training...my pack has 2 bottle holders. Had an old version of this bottle...works great. Ordered 2 more. Filled one for the 3rd time, and its leaking at the bottom somewhere already. 😔 I was getting soaked and couldn't figure out why. Tightened top, made sure not open, the squeezed it and a steady stream came out😡 For the price, I would expect better quality control.
customer_reviews.author: MaryRN

customer_reviews.title: So much better than a poly-bottle
customer_reviews.text: These compresses down, and stand up great while drinking. I've used several, all excellent -- the best I've ever used for camping. I got some for friends, and convinced them to buy their own. They're excellent. Pro tip: Use this for travel, keep an insulated bottle for home to prevent "sweat" from ice or cold drinks.
customer_reviews.author: Kastan Day

customer_reviews.title: Impresses all my friends
customer_reviews.text: I love getting specialized travel stuff. This is one of the coolest things I have for travel since it folds up so easily but is a full sized water bottle when I need it. Whenever someone sees me folding it up when I'm done, they always sound amazed.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Good size, can be squished down to fit in tight backpack pockets. No a fan of the black but I needed fast and that's the color they had. Used for a week no leaks. Did the job.
customer_reviews.author: Gary C

customer_reviews.title: great little water bottles - love freezing them the night ...
customer_reviews.text: great little water bottles - love freezing them the night before I do a day hike so that it is nice and cold. Also love how they roll and are compact when not in use. Water does taste a little funky but that is to be expected with any plastic bottle to some degree
customer_reviews.author: Joe Mount

customer_reviews.title: Mold grew at the bottom
customer_reviews.text: I bought all three sizes of Vapur water bottle. This one grew mold at the bottom after a few uses. The bottle of the 0.7L was melted in dishwasher. The 0.5L is the only one that is still usable after a few months. However, I can’t fill to the top at the water fountain at work as the water doesn’t come down from the top. I could have bought many bottles of water with the money I wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Da

customer_reviews.title: Light weight great for short hikes
customer_reviews.text: I really like these. I took these on a camping trip and they were great to use since they are lightweight and since it does not have a rigid structure can be packed away easily. I also like taking them on short hikes especially in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Paradoxious

customer_reviews.title: The bottle is great; the finish not so much.
customer_reviews.text: Premise: I own 5 of this type of water bottle (big-mouth Vapur) First, this looks more black than dark blue. Second, it works great like the others but the matte finish is wearing off. It's not a big a deal (I'm actually not sure where the matte has gone; it's not like it's peeling; more so I can scratch it off like a lotto ticket.) The bottle just looks "over" loved. Also, it's been to the pool a lot and been in a ton of contact sun-screened hands; maybe its' made the matte go away faster. Either way, I highly recommend Vapur big mouth style water bottles (easy to clean and NO yucky spout smell after MONTHS of use!)
customer_reviews.author: Lisaleee

customer_reviews.title: hydration is important.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and stores easily. Seems strong and durable. I had a first generation one of these, and it worked great for years until I left it on a plane. I left it on a plane because it was so small it's easy to miss, so maybe I should lower my rating? Also, I liked the old cap style a little better than this one. Not enough to affect my rating.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Crawford

customer_reviews.title: It’s wonderful. Until it isn’t.
customer_reviews.text: I tracked my amazon order history. I’ve bought eight of these. I lost two. The rest leak, eventually. They all leak. The pictures they show about folding and rolling? Lies. Freezing? Uh-uh. You can’t even apply pressure on it. You really have to baby it. BUT, if you can manage to avoid every bit of their marketing, it’s an awesome collapsible water bottle. So I use them until they fall apart and buy another until a competitor comes along that’s worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: Dana C

customer_reviews.title: Most mobile and versatile bottle I have owned for hiking.
customer_reviews.text: This bottle is the most mobile bottle I have ever used especially for outdoor/hiking activities. I also use a hydroflask along side with this one but the hydroflask is so heavy and u definitely feel the burden of it on a hike. It rolls up to almost nothing and i dont even notice i have a bottle with me when i finish it.
customer_reviews.author: JHa

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful and Handy
customer_reviews.text: Extremely efficient, lightweight, and packable. The carabiner, however, is flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I take it everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept of these bottles. I lost my previous Vapur on a hike, it came unclipped from my pack, my bad. I purchased this larger one and love the added capacity. The top closes tightly when not in use and easily opens for a quick drink. I purchased the night blue. After several uses the shell looks a bit crackled and worn but still works fine. I haven't figured out how to keep it totally clean and not musty smelling. I purchased some cheap versions which just don't match up, they leak and the plastic breaks at the clip. Vapur it's the way to go although not perfect
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: The design is sleek but not functional. We bought ...
customer_reviews.text: The design is sleek but not functional. We bought 2 bottles for our trip to Europe. Within 5 days both of them were leaking at the seams where the cap attaches to the bag. It made several of our bags wet and left us parched for fluids when we needed them.. Highly not reccomend this product as they need to fix the design or manufacturing issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great collapsible water bottle!
customer_reviews.text: Quality doesn't seem like it will be lifetime durability, but it's well built and should last for many adventures carabiner is a nice addition but seems like it could be the first part to break.
customer_reviews.author: neverx

customer_reviews.title: You'll wake everyone on the plane up!
customer_reviews.text: Noisy! Purchased for a 15 hour flight. If you attempt to get it out when other are sleeping, they won't be. I'll just carry an empty water bottle and fill it at the airport.
customer_reviews.author: JC in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for space saving.
customer_reviews.text: I like that it rolls up and the clips holds it together. The Cammoflauge pattern is great and it doesn’t make any sort of crinkling noise unless you squeeze it, it’s great in the tree stand. I fill it up and clip it to the loop on my backpack strap.
customer_reviews.author: OBGX54

customer_reviews.title: NO PLASTIC TASTE.  Great quality.  Perfect for a runner or hiker.
customer_reviews.text: These are my go to outdoors, hiking, running water containers. They have NO taste, nothing, zero. I have tried a lot of water reservoirs like what come with back packs and they all taste horrible. The last set of the Vapurs I got lasted 2 years with a ton of hikes. For an ultralight hiker/runner it is hard to find something more durable and as light while also being tiny (rolled up).
customer_reviews.author: Upgrade Taos Computers

customer_reviews.title: Clip needs work
customer_reviews.text: The bottle itself is great. Rolls up, doesn't leak, lasted two multi day backpacking trips and several flights so far. HOWEVER. That orange clip is awful and constantly detaches for no apparent reason. The bottle's fallen off the clip at least once a week since I got it. It is literally the worst thing about the bottle. This is also not a handicap friendly drinking vessel (although that should have been obvious from the product itself so this is more my fault for not noticing) - you need two hands to use this.
customer_reviews.author: Meri A.

customer_reviews.title: The smartest must have thing for travel.
customer_reviews.text: Of all the things I bought here on amazon I think this is the smartest must have thing for travel. It sure is durable and spill-proof and it's very convenient for a traveler like me. You can have the foldable bottle filled up anywhere and once it's empty fold it and no bulgy bottle inside your bag. I am not sure though if this can hold hot drinks, I haven't tested it yet. I recommend this foldable bottle to every traveler out there like me.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Fry

customer_reviews.title: Hole after one day!
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this and so when I booked my trip to Italy, the thought of a reusable water bottle that I could pack easy this was the one I went with. Bad idea. After one afternoon of using it the bottom got a hole in it. The plastic bent and where it bent a leak started. I didn't even get to use it after my first day on a 15 day trip... needless to say I was seriously disappointed. DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: arianna

customer_reviews.title: They hold water and your hand!
customer_reviews.text: These are good for the runner that doesn't like their water to slosh in their hand. Not many people run with stuff in their hand, but i find it helps me keep going on a marathon. And obviously backpacking these are great for interior stowage and exterior storage when you find fresh water to fill them. The carbiner makes it easy to attach to.. something.
customer_reviews.author: cliffclof

customer_reviews.title: Loved the product, hate the durability
customer_reviews.text: I was a huge fan of this hydro flask. Everything was ideal about it, satisfying to use for day-to-day and camping. Lightweight too! But sadly after just a month or two the threaded screw from the cap to the flask broke, and no longer will my bottle stay shut. I wouldn't buy it again because although I loved it I don't want to have to get a new bottle every few months.
customer_reviews.author: gratitude

customer_reviews.title: Sprang a leak after one use.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two Vapur flexible water bottles for a 32 mile mountain run I do every year. We typically run out of water along the run, so I needed something to carry extra water in. A nalgene bottle would be too bulky, so the Vapur seemed like a great idea. After one 12 mile training run it developed a leak in my running pack and soaked everything. Not good when you depend on that extra water to get you through a really long run!! I'm extremely disappointed in this product. Don't waste your money....
customer_reviews.author: Diane Rondeau

customer_reviews.title: Durable, easy to use and doesn't get musty!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I only use mine for water, but use it often. It stays clean (no musty smell or mold), is durable (I've frozen it a few times - oops) and is easy to fill. I've gotten a lot of comments along the line of "What IS that?" because it doesn't look like your typical collapsible water bottle. My favorite way to use it is to bring it empty and folded to sporting events/concerts so I can fill it with water once I'm there and not pay for the $$$$$ bottled water. I'm cheap, but stay hydrated, so what? I'd buy it again but haven't had to because it's so well made. Win!
customer_reviews.author: QuintonDymke

customer_reviews.title: Good first impression.
customer_reviews.text: I think the size is a bit small in this color green/orange. There was no noticeable change in water taste. The cap make a loud pop noise when you open and close. When you fold, it condences to aprox 3x2 in space. I will update review after I use it a few more times.
customer_reviews.author: Yuwarami

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite
customer_reviews.text: This was not my favorite collapsible water bottle. When water is in it, the clip does not work very well bcse the water weighs down on the clip making the clip come undone. This makes it especially hard to hook on my bag and carry around because if I make the wrong move, the water bottle will fall off because of the weak clip.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: Water bottle that folds and attaches to back pack
customer_reviews.text: Great for space limited bags and they have a carabiners. Not what I really wanted as they dont keep water cold. I used them for trip to China. Was good for immediate drink when cold and to keep out of bag. Just more weight to be honest one back pack. But if that is what you need, than this is good for that reason. Rolling it up and locking it is also a plus.
customer_reviews.author: anissa569

customer_reviews.title: Love the clip on the lid and the color schemes ...
customer_reviews.text: I ADORE these bottles! So smart-- when you're done drinking they nearly disappear. No bulky, heavy bottle. I have several and keep them in the fridge and then pop one in my bag whenever I go out-- always hydrated, never wasteful. I have had to replace a few of them after years of use because the seams start to leak a bit, but considering how much I use them I can't complain. Love the clip on the lid and the color schemes too-- I have pink and teal and my man-friend has navy and orange...aren't we cute ;-)
customer_reviews.author: CornDog

customer_reviews.title: The Platonic Ideal of Water Bottles.
customer_reviews.text: I'm officially obsessed. I ordered a couple different bottles to test out for taking on a long trip, and this one is the absolute best, bar none. It's comfortable to carry, easy to fill, convenient to clip to things like kayaks, it doesn't have any sort of taste, it looks great, and it packs away to nothing. It even stands up on its own (if it's not completely full you can blow in a bit of air to get it to stand well). I've already ordered two more. My family is tired of me gushing about how much I love it. It's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Looking forward to trying it out.
customer_reviews.text: Material is a little thinner than I was expecting, but no complaints because I haven't had the chance to try it out yet. Bought it to take with me on holiday in Europe, so I'll edit my review according. It's easy to roll up, doesn't have an order, and the spout it nice and wide.
customer_reviews.author: V. O.

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: This was my third Vapur bottle. The first one I had I loved, but I lost it. I ordered a second one which was bad from the day I received it. Where the threads meet the bottle, it would leak if left lying on its side with water in it. I ordered a replacement, and the replacement has the same issue. I never had this issue with my first one, but I will not buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Think Water... and stay alive!
customer_reviews.text: These are a must have for survivalists, campers, hikers and anybody who needs to carry extra water without taking up go-bag space. My go bag has a G.I. canteen and a CamelBak bottle on the outside, but I keep one of these Vapur bottles rolled up inside, just in case. These are RUGGED for a collapsible and can hang on a bag loop with the built-in carabiner. If things go bad, water is the most important commodity to take with you, or collect along the way. Without water you will die. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: The JudgeTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: I loved it so much
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bottle in preparation of an international trip with a lot of hiking. Due to its design, it was convenient to put in my backpack as I ran through the airport and would fill up after security. This bottle also stood the test of a strenuous hike through Norway. This bottle was dropped in gravel and snow repeatedly. I had clipped this to my backpack but must have not screwed it on tight enough so I lost it at Trolltunga. I loved it so much, I came back and bought a second for travel/hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: By far the best
customer_reviews.text: Vapur is the only brand of this style water bottle I'll ever use. I have beat the crap out of these bottles and never has one failed on me. I keep a few extra as back-ups in case one does get a hole in it...it's been a few years now and I'm still using the first ones I got. The blackout style looks awesome and is made just as tough as the others.
customer_reviews.author: C. Link

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel Bottle - A Few Improvements Needed
customer_reviews.text: The bottle is very compact and lightweight, which is why I purchased it. However, after some use, the snap cap does not seal fully and it now leaks if it is on it's side. Also, the matte finish rubs off pretty quickly. I would still recommend, just a few things to note/improve.
customer_reviews.author: Vitruvian Performance

customer_reviews.title: For me the biggest selling point is the ability to unscrew the top for easy ice cubes filling and bottle scrubber cleaning
customer_reviews.text: After years of using platypus bottles, I have moved up to these. For me the biggest selling point is the ability to unscrew the top for easy ice cubes filling and bottle scrubber cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Arrived With Hole In Bottom, Unusable, Liked Previous Purchases
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these years ago, loved the lightweight design, handy carabiner, but tried to put things other than water in it and it started to dissolve. Figuring that was on me, I bought another one, about 2017, and only put water in it, good use for years before it recently got a hole in the bottom, so I again bought another to replace it. The last one I bought arrived with a hole in it and dripped everywhere, was not able to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Parkhurst

customer_reviews.title: Super smart!
customer_reviews.text: Holds a full liter. Clips onto things for access. Folds down to nothing. And lllasts. I had my last one for years and then left it on a plane :-((( Major bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: pk opines

customer_reviews.title: Worked well.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I bought these for our trip to SE Asia. They worked as expected. Once filled up the bottle stands up. Once it’s empty it collapses so it’s easy for storage space. Great for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Great for my needs!
customer_reviews.text: Loved it. Just returned from a 3 week vacation with 90+ degree heat and 60% humidity. Very small when empty and of course light weight. Would freeze water overnight so after 5 hours of sightseeing I would still have cold water. Held up great with no leaks and the cap was watertight.
customer_reviews.author: cefu63

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Best of the best here. Refill is easy flip top is solid and the bottle is durable. I bought another 1 to cycle from my work cooler.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: doesnt smell like plastic
customer_reviews.text: This my second one. The first one broke a leak after 3 years of everyday use. Very nice quality.
customer_reviews.author: Propboy502

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This my 2nd bottle not as a replacement I keep 1 in my cooler and 1 by my side all day while driving. Love this bottle
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad product if you want help upping your water intake; however, when the container starts to heat up to room temperature, the condensation on the bottle makes a bit of a mess. Would be hard to travel with it like that - flimsy clamp or not.
customer_reviews.author: Gimme_a_break

customer_reviews.title: Excellent reusable water bottle, particularly for airplane travels
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Vapur bottle (the first developed mold on the lid). I bought the a size up from my previous one and although initially seemed too big it's nice to be able to carry extra water. Since the bottle is squeezable if not fully filled it's very simple to put away in any bag pocket. Love all the same things it shares with my previous one, super small when compacted, easily fillable anywhere thanks to the large opening, very light and resistant. The only downside compared to my previous one is the mate finish quickly gets marks all over.
customer_reviews.author: Tysher

customer_reviews.title: Good concept, poor design (lasted less than a week)
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to save weight on 3 week SE Asia trip. Terrible product. Leaked within 3 days, where the cap screws on the bottle. Worse part is it got my daypack and phone wet. Good concept, poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I've had 3 of these and they were outstanding all the way but one i blew it up due to dropping a weight on it by accident and the other one i lost. The material is tough even then I've dropped other weights or dropped at high altitudes. Great pro that its collapsible and store is anywhere, ANYWHERE
customer_reviews.author: Luar

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but solid
customer_reviews.text: I've bought one of these for every family member (if they're into the outdoors, that is!). Such a great gift. Very solid material and I have zero concerns about this leaking. The clip is very useful and the bottle rolls up compactly when it's empty. Great for those of us who hike regularly and want to keep space free and weight at a minimum. I will say they can be tricky to drink out of if you don't have a good handle on them but that's true for every bottle! ;)
customer_reviews.author: Jess E.

customer_reviews.title: A Great Bottle for All Occasions!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and I love it! It holds a good amount of water for when I go hiking with my wife. Between both of our bottles, we usually don't run out of water until the end of the trip. It has a nice carabiner built in that I use to clip them onto my bag, or when I don't have that, to my belt. The only downside is that after washing them, they don't like to dry very well. I still need to find something to hold them and let them dry.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: They are nice and light but the plastic clips were not strong enough to stay attached to pack when full.
customer_reviews.author: Jschwartzott

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS FROM THE TOP LID :(
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product. I was using it every day. I travel all the time and it was perfect bc when not in use, I could roll it and it saved so much space in my travel bag. The only problem was when it started to leak, it was getting my macbook and other items in my bag wet. NO BUENO! So if they could fix the leak problem, I would give this a 5 start for sure. I love the material, easy to clean and the handle at the top was good to carry on it's own. PLEASE FIX THIS, I REALLY LIKE THE CONCEPT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: planned obsolescence?
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fan of this lightweight, easy-to-carry bottle. For my summer walks with the dog, I leave it half-full in the freezer and then top it up before heading out: the ice melts gradually and I've got ice cold water on the 90+-degree days here in the Washington area. BUT I'm buying a new one every year because it springs a leak. I do not subject the bottle to rough handling; and since it's touted as freezer-suitable, that shouldn't affect its durability. Vapur, please look into this and fix the problem.
customer_reviews.author: C.H. Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this style of bottle, but had gone through many others as they kept breaking or leaking. After one year of HEAVY use, this one is still going strong! Pros: +Light weight, without sacrificing strength. +Built-in carabiner makes it easy to attach anywhere you need +Large opening makes filling easy, unlike many competitors +Freezable! You can easily use this as an ice pack, no problems. +No leaks! In over a year of use, this bottle has stayed strong and leak free Cons: -We didn't buy this one first! If you are a hiker, or just want a convenient, lightweight water bottle, look no further!
customer_reviews.author: Mc

customer_reviews.title: Solid Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice water bottle that avts as advertised. It stands by itself and works well when frozen. The cap was a positive snapping lock as well. I bought Outdoor Products collapsible water bottle (under $3) to compare. While I like the fact the Eclipse's material is more flexible, I think I would opt for a translucent material in the future so I can be certian it is dried out (like the Outdoor Product's (OP) material). I also like the wider opening on the OP's model, makes it easier to fill.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Becker

customer_reviews.title: Solid top, great taste, no smell. great bottle.
customer_reviews.text: this is a great bottle. no plastic taste whatsoever and i haven't even cleaned it yet after months....one thing i hated with solid bottles (Nalgene) was they would start smelling bad around the opening pretty quick and needed washing often. the flip and lock top is VERY solid and wont open accidentally. i want to have the smaller version also as this is pretty big for just a few hours of basic activity. i seldom finish it off. i wouldnt waste money on anything cheaper unless its for a kid to run and play with...enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: D.S

customer_reviews.title: Good water bottle
customer_reviews.text: I have several collapsible water bottle before. all are platypus brand. My trusty 0.5l platypus starting to age so I'm looking for a replacement. I'm attracted to try vapur mainly because of the handle. The handle turned out to be okay. its useful but didn't exceed my expectation. I also find vapur has larger neck diameter which I like. Its easier to refill water and I can even drop small ice too. the bottle itself seems alright, feels a little bit stiffer than platy. platy material feels more malleable. The 0.2l extra capacity also nice without making the bottle to big.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Jamin

product_meta.title: Vapur Eclipse Flexible Water Bottle - with Carabiner
product_meta.description: Hydrate your need, Adrenaline Junkie! Every day should be a new adventure and the bottle you drink from should be as flexible as you. That's why the Vapur Element and integrated SuperCap were designed from the ground-up to meet the performance needs of outdoor enthusiasts everywhere. The Elements patented flexible design is lighter and easier to hold than rigid bottles, keeping you hydrated no matter the terrain.
feature_bullets: This water bottle holds .70 liter/23 ounces of liquid
The Vapur Eclipse water bottle has a unique matte finish that will patina beautifully over time
This water bottle is foldable, portable, reusable, durable, freezable, dishwasher safe; as well as BPA, odor and taste free
Wide mouth opening. Simply unscrew the Super Cap from the bottle to reveal the wide opening. Great for filling and cleaning your bottle!
The Vapur Eclipse water bottle features a Super Cap - flip cap. This cap has a tough seal and is easy to open. The cap allows you to remain active without worrying about spills or leaks

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
